I live in a B Listed converted church with large stained glass windows. We are in the process of putting together a planning application for several changes to the property, one of them being secondary glazing.

Message: We are a small church in Canonmills, Edinburgh with 4 arched (possibly Crittall) metal windows. They are in the kitchen and toilet and measure about 2 x 1 metres. The hopper opening is rusted and possibly warped in 3 cases. Winter is coming and cold draughts! May I send you photos?

It’s filling holes with wood filler, and some beading around one wall and painting our draught proof beading with external top coat paint. I’ve taken videos showing the work. All stock will be on site.  PLUS IRONMONGERY   see David (TE/DF)
